law.text: The Attorney General may prosecute an appeal, without security, in any case from which an appeal will lie whenever, in his judgment, the interest of the Commonwealth demands it.
law.history: Amended 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 14, sec. 2. -- Amended 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 62, sec. 8. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 116.
